--- title: ResNetX2 keywords: fastai sidebar: home_sidebar summary: "a folded ResNet" --- 
from fastcore.all import *  # test_eq

class InitBlock[source]

InitBlock(Unit:Module, ni:int, fold:int, stride:int=1, **kwargs) :: Module

Init block of folded ResNet

m = InitBlock(mbconv, 16, 4, stride=1, nh=32)
x = torch.randn(2,16,32,32)
xs = m(x)
len(xs), xs[0].shape

(4, torch.Size([2, 16, 32, 32]))

class FoldBlock[source]

FoldBlock(Unit:Module, ni:int, fold:int, stride:int=1, **kwargs) :: Module

Basic block of folded ResNet

m = FoldBlock(mbconv, 16, 4, stride=2, nh=32)

xs2 = m(*xs)

len(xs2),xs2[0].shape,xs2[1].shape,xs2[2].shape,xs2[3].shape

(4,
 torch.Size([2, 16, 16, 16]),
 torch.Size([2, 16, 16, 16]),
 torch.Size([2, 16, 16, 16]),
 torch.Size([2, 16, 16, 16]))

class ResNetX2[source]

ResNetX2(Stem, Unit, fold:int, ni:int, num_nodes:tuple, bottle_scale:int=1, first_downsample:bool=False, c_in:int=3, c_out:int=10, **kwargs) :: Module

A folded resnet.

num_nodes = [8]*4
model = ResNetX2(Stem=conv_bn, Unit=mbconv, fold=4, ni=64, num_nodes=num_nodes, bottle_scale=2)
num_params(model)

tensor(1803850)
x = torch.randn(2,3,64,64)

with torch.autograd.set_detect_anomaly(True):
    out = model(x)
    out.mean().backward()
